summary:
Filmmaker and Creative Director with a demonstrated history of multimedia content production for Editorial, international NGOs, Public Institutions, and Private Clients.
Skilled in Film Production, Journalism, Storytelling, EU Funding, Digital Media, and Creative Direction.
Media professional with an extensive background in filmmaking, journalism and research undertook between UC Berkeley, UCSD and Sapienza Univesity.

treasury_media.title: Books not Bombs
treasury_media.description: Books not Bombs is a documentary project at the centre of an international fundraising campaign aimed at supporting the history and civic education in Ukraine. Go to www.booksnotbombs.org to know more

treasury_media.title: Changing the Chants Official Trailer
treasury_media.description:
Changing the Chants is a 25 minutes long documentary aiming at presenting a multiperspective investigation on the problem of Anti-Semitism in football. In an incredible trip throughout Europe, going through empty stadiums, museums, and remembrance sites, including Auschwitz and Birkenau Concentration Camp, the filmmaker guides the viewer through the darkest period of our time to present how it relates to contemporary society.

Language: English
Locations: The Netherlands, Germany, Poland.

treasury_media.title: ACCEPTED (2020) Official Trailer
treasury_media.description:
"Accepted" is a Sci-Fi short film that I wrote and directed. The film among other awards it won the prestigious Berlin Independent Film Festival 2021.

Synopsis: 
Sarah, the Lead Developer at Gaia Inc., is about to launch her latest and most promising project: Theia, a device that is bound to revolutionize the way people interact with each other. The success of the long-anticipated Theia device is without question, however, its impact on Sarah and the rest of society is a whole other matter.

treasury_media.title: Clash of Memories
treasury_media.description:
“Clash of Memories: 75 years after the end of WWII in Europe” (9,26 minutes) 

The film is produced by the EU-Russia Civil Society Forum within its “Remembering the Past: History without Borders” Programme and directed by Stefano di Pietro. The film is kindly supported by the European Union, the Federal Foreign Office of Germany, the Netherlands Ministry of Foreign Affairs and the OAK Foundation.

treasury_media.title: The Right to Play (Trailer)
treasury_media.description:
"The Right to Play" is a 25 minutes long documentary I directed about St. Ambreous, a football team founded in Milan made of refugees and asylum seekers that aim to the recognition of their rights to play football but most importantly to be recognized in their own community.

The project was funded by the EU and produced by Anne Frank House, Euroclio - European Association of History Educators, Fare Network, Eintracht Frankfurt Museum, The Romanian Football Federation and Evenzo Consultancy.

projects.title: Echoes of the Crowd
projects.description:
Role:
Creator
Director

Echoes of the Crowd is an Interactive Installation for Interactive Floor and Live Visuals, an immersive environment in which past and present coexist in a way that is self-evident to the senses. The elements of the ecosystem are self-reinforcing and amplified within the environment in its creation and disintegration, the sounds are created by the users unconsciously.. and a new track is created and persists…

Echoes of the Crowd premiered at Spring Attitude Festival 2016 in Rome (IT)

projects.title: ETMA™ (Embodied Thinking in Multimedia Arts)
projects.description:
Role: 
Creator
Instructor

E.T.M.A.™ is the result of an integration of different perspectives, backgrounds and experiences to create a workshop that could be not only an instrument of knowledge for any performing artist but a tool for developing cognitive abilities related to movement and sound perception that can deeply influence the way any artist perform and conceptualise his art.

Through the use of an innovative interactive platform the participants will be able to explore the sonic side of any scenic action or dance movement. The sound of any movement amplified will define and express a number of qualities that could not be expressed in any way by the vision exclusively.

Together with the excercises a theoretical part on Cognitive Science, Philosophy of Language and Psychoacoustics will help the participants reframe the relation between movement and sound as well as the relation between the different senses.

projects.title: Sound Shape
projects.description:
Role: 
Director 

Sound Shape is a Contemporary Art Performance Developed by the Metapherein Collective

Is a performance designed to create a generative circle originated from motion that is transformed into sound and then again shaped into visual stimuli. Making use of the interactive interface Terpsiphone, Live visuals, a webcam and a performer, Sound Shape express the continuous flow between different senses in the perception of the environment and underline the connection among them.

projects.title: WhoLoDancE (EU-Funded Research Project)
projects.description:
Role: Project Manager

WhoLoDancE is a three years Research and Innovation Action funded under the European Union's  Horizon 2020 Programme. 

Total EU contribution: € 3,332,585.00
Starting Date: January 1st, 2016          
Duration: 36 months
Project Number: 688865 

The Project aims at developing and applying breakthrough technologies to Dance in order to:

1.	Investigate bodily knowledge by applying Similarity search tools, computational models, emotional content analysis and techniques for the automated analysis of non-verbal expressive movement to dance data that will help investigate principles, vocabularies, mental imagery and simulation connected to Dance Practises.

2.	Preserve the Cultural Heritage by creating a proof-of-concept of a motion capture repository of dance motions built in a method allowing interpolations, extrapolations and synthesis through similarity search among different compositions documenting diverse and specialized dance movement practices.

3.	Innovate the Teaching of Dance by developing life-size volumetric display that will enable a dance student to literally step inside the Dance master’s body that through the use of immersive and responsive motion capture data, will Identify and respond to collisions between the physical and virtual bodies.

4.	Revolutionize Choreography by building and structuring an interactive repository of motion capture dance libraries. Custom dance data blending engine will give choreographers and dance teachers a powerful tool to blend and assemble an infinite number of dance compositions.

5.	Widen the access and practice of Dance by providing access to the created dance database through commercially available consumer electronics motion capture devices like the MS Kinect, Intel’s real sense and others

projects.title: Cardioproof (EU-Funded Project)
projects.description:
Role: Project Manager

CARDIOPROOF is a project to determine the applicability and effectiveness of predictive modelling and simulation tools for cardiology. Consolidating the outcomes of previous Virtual Physiological Human (VPH) projects, CARDIOPROOF will validate the tools in interrelated clinical trials. These trials will be conducted at three European centres of excellence in cardiac treatment: The Ospedale Pediatrico Bambin Gesù, in Rome; University College of London’s Great Ormond Street Hospital for Children NHS Foundation Trust (GOSH); and the Deutsches Herzzentrum Hospital of Berlin.

contributors.headline: Filmmaker + Creative Director

projects.title: MD-Paedigree (EU-Funded Project)
projects.description:
Role: Project Manager

MD-Paedigree represents a clinically-driven and strongly VPH-rooted project, where 7 world-renowned clinical centres of excellence pursue improved interoperability of paediatric biomedical information, data and knowledge by developing together a set of reusable and adaptable multi-scale models for more predictive, individualised, effective and safer paediatric healthcare, being scientifically and technologically supported by one of the leading industrial actors in medical applications in Europe operating in conjunction with highly qualified SMEs and some of the most experienced research partners in the VPH community.

contributors.headline: Filmmaker + Creative Director

projects.title: The Language of the political Leadership between the first and the second Republic: Statistical and Linguistic analysis of parliamentary speeches
projects.description:
Role:
Researcher

The project investigated the changes that characterized the first 65 years from the start of the Parliamentary Republic from the I Legislation in 1948 until the XVI which ended in 2013, by making statistical and linguistic analysis of the political speeches of 30 selected speakers among the most influential political leaders of the national History. In the first part of the research project a corpus was created with more than 1600 speeches given at the Chamber of deputies. The textual source was the official parliamentary reports released by the Chamber of Deputy. The corpus was composed by approximately 5 mil occurrences for a total of 91.000 different words used. Starting from this corpus the different member of the research project performed analysis following different approaches such as sociological, linguistic and statistic. The project was promoted by the Associazione ex-parlamentari (Association of the Former Members of Parliament) and was presented twice at the Chamber of Deputies of Italy.
